Yes, that's another great aspect of Stranger Things! The show was able to balance horror and humor so well, which is not an easy feat to accomplish. It had its incredibly scary moments where the tension was palpably high, but it also had its lighthearted moments where viewers could laugh and feel connected to the characters. 

The humor helped to bring some levity to the show and to make it more relatable and engaging for viewers. It also helped to deepen the relationships between the characters, as they were able to share moments of lightheartedness and humor amidst the chaos and danger around them.

Overall, the balance of horror and humor helped to make Stranger Things a show that had something for everyone. It kept viewers on the edge of their seats with its heart-pounding horror moments, while also providing a much-needed sense of comedic relief.
